Course Description: A COMPREHENSIVE STUDY OF BASIC CONCEPTS, PHILOSOPHY, STANDARDS, PROCEDURES, AND PRACTICES OF INTERNAL AUDITING.  THE COURSE OFFERS THE STUDENT AN OVERALL UNDERSTANDING AND APPRECIATION OF THE ROLE OF INTERNAL AUDITING IN AN ORGANIZATION.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
1.IDENTIFY INTERNAL AUDIT STANDARDS, GUIDELINES, AND EMERGING ISSUES SUCH AS THE COSO ERM MODEL, SARBANES OXLEY AND THE NEW IPPF INTERNAL AUDITING STANDARDS.
2.IDENTIFY RISKS AND CONTROLS.
3.DEVELOP AN AUDIT PROGRAM ALONG WITH EXECUTION OF FIELDWORK AND PREPARE THE FINAL AUDIT REPORT.
4.DISTINGUISH BETWEEN VARIOUS INDUSTRIES DIFFERENCES IN MAJOR PROCESSES, RISK AND EVALUATION OF OPERATIONAL DATA.
5.DISCUSS THE IMPORTANCE OF BUSINESS PROCESSES IN THE INTERNAL AUDIT PROCESS ALONG WITH THE VARIANCES OF AUDIT GROUPS BASED ON INDUSTRY AND OTHER ENVIRONMENTAL FACTORS. 
6.IDENTIFY THE CONCEPTS OF EFFICIENT AND EFFECTIVELY CONTROLLED ENVIRONMENTS AND WHY THESE CONTROLS MAY NOT BE NECESSARY. 
7.PERFORM AN INTERNAL AUDIT AND PREPARE AN INTERNAL AUDIT REPORT.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
